t: Psalm 119
א Aleph
Blessed*pn are those whose ways are blameless, who*ld walk according to the law of the Lord.*s
Blessed*ln are those who keep his statutes and*ld seek him with all their heart—
they*ln do no wrong but*ld follow his ways.
You*ln have laid down precepts that*ld are to be fully obeyed.
Oh,*ln that my ways were steadfast in*ld obeying your decrees!
Then*ln I would not be put to shame when*ld I consider all your commands.
I*ln will praise you with an upright heart as*ld I learn your righteous laws.
I*ln will obey your decrees; do*ld not utterly forsake me.
ב Beth
How*pn can a young person stay on the path of purity? By*ld living according to your word.
I*ln seek you with all my heart; do*ld not let me stray from your commands.
I*ln have hidden your word in my heart that*ld I might not sin against you.
Praise*ln be to you, Lord;*s teach*ld me your decrees.
With*ln my lips I recount all*ld the laws that come from your mouth.
I*ln rejoice in following your statutes as*ld one rejoices in great riches.
I*ln meditate on your precepts and*ld consider your ways.
I*ln delight in your decrees; I*ld will not neglect your word.
ג Gimel
Be*pn good to your servant while I live, that*ld I may obey your word.
Open*ln my eyes that I may see wonderful*ld things in your law.
I*ln am a stranger on earth; do*ld not hide your commands from me.
My*ln soul is consumed with longing for*ld your laws at all times.
You*ln rebuke the arrogant, who are accursed, those*ld who stray from your commands.
Remove*ln from me their scorn and contempt, for*ld I keep your statutes.
Though*ln rulers sit together and slander me, your*ld servant will meditate on your decrees.

ד Daleth
I*pn am laid low in the dust; preserve*ld my life according to your word.

Keep*ln me from deceitful ways; be*ld gracious to me and teach me your law.

I*ln hold fast to your statutes, Lord;*s do*ld not let me be put to shame.
I*ln run in the path of your commands, for*ld you have broadened my understanding.
ה He
Teach*pn me, Lord,*s the way of your decrees, that*ld I may follow it to the end.
Give*ln me understanding, so that I may keep your law and*ld obey it with all my heart.

Turn*ln my eyes away from worthless things; preserve*ld my life according to your word.

How*ln I long for your precepts! In*ld your righteousness preserve my life.
ו Waw
May*pn your unfailing love come to me, Lord,*s your*ld salvation, according to your promise;

Never*ln take your word of truth from my mouth, for*ld I have put my hope in your laws.
I*ln will always obey your law, for*ld ever and ever.

I*ln will speak of your statutes before kings and*ld will not be put to shame,

ז Zayin
Remember*pn your word to your servant, for*ld you have given me hope.
My*ln comfort in my suffering is this: Your*ld promise preserves my life.
The*ln arrogant mock me unmercifully, but*ld I do not turn from your law.
I*ln remember, Lord,*s your ancient laws, and*ld I find comfort in them.
Indignation*ln grips me because of the wicked, who*ld have forsaken your law.
Your*ln decrees are the theme of my song wherever*ld I lodge.
In*ln the night, Lord,*s I remember your name, that*ld I may keep your law.

ח Heth
You*pn are my portion, Lord;*s I*ld have promised to obey your words.
I*ln have sought your face with all my heart; be*ld gracious to me according to your promise.

The*ln earth is filled with your love, Lord;*s teach*ld me your decrees.
ט Teth
Do*pn good to your servant according*ld to your word, Lord.*s
Teach*ln me knowledge and good judgment, for*ld I trust your commands.
Before*ln I was afflicted I went astray, but*ld now I obey your word.
You*ln are good, and what you do is good; teach*ld me your decrees.
Though*ln the arrogant have smeared me with lies, I*ld keep your precepts with all my heart.

It*ln was good for me to be afflicted so*ld that I might learn your decrees.
The*ln law from your mouth is more precious to me than*ld thousands of pieces of silver and gold.
י Yodh
Your*pn hands made me and formed me; give*ld me understanding to learn your commands.
May*ln those who fear you rejoice when they see me, for*ld I have put my hope in your word.
I*ln know, Lord,*s that your laws are righteous, and*ld that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.

May*ln the arrogant be put to shame for wronging me without cause; but*ld I will meditate on your precepts.

May*ln I wholeheartedly follow your decrees, that*ld I may not be put to shame.
כ Kaph
My*pn soul faints with longing for your salvation, but*ld I have put my hope in your word.
My*ln eyes fail, looking for your promise; I*ld say, “When will you comfort me?”
Though*ln I am like a wineskin in the smoke, I*ld do not forget your decrees.

The*ln arrogant dig pits to trap me, contrary*ld to your law.

In*ln your unfailing love preserve my life, that*ld I may obey the statutes of your mouth.
ל Lamedh
Your*pn word, Lord,*s is eternal; it*ld stands firm in the heavens.
Your*ln faithfulness continues through all generations; you*ld established the earth, and it endures.
Your*ln laws endure to this day, for*ld all things serve you.

To*ln all perfection I see a limit, but*ld your commands are boundless.

Oh,*pn how I love your law! I*ld meditate on it all day long.

The*ln wicked have set a snare for me, but*ld I have not strayed from your precepts.

ס Samekh
I*pn hate double-minded people, but*ld I love your law.
You*ln are my refuge and my shield; I*ld have put my hope in your word.
Away*ln from me, you evildoers, that*ld I may keep the commands of my God!

You*ln reject all who stray from your decrees, for*ld their delusions come to nothing.

My*ln flesh trembles in fear of you; I*ld stand in awe of your laws.
ע Ayin
I*pn have done what is righteous and just; do*ld not leave me to my oppressors.

My*ln eyes fail, looking for your salvation, looking*ld for your righteous promise.
Deal*ln with your servant according to your love and*ld teach me your decrees.

It*ln is time for you to act, Lord;*s your*ld law is being broken.
Because*ln I love your commands more*ld than gold, more than pure gold,

פ Pe
Your*pn statutes are wonderful; therefore*ld I obey them.
The*ln unfolding of your words gives light; it*ld gives understanding to the simple.

צ Tsadhe
You*pn are righteous, Lord,*s and*ld your laws are right.

I*pn call with all my heart; answer me, Lord,*s and*ld I will obey your decrees.

ת Taw
